verses.verse: (1 An earnest exhortation to praise God,4 for the government of the world and the election of the Church.8 An admonition not to follow the rebellion of the old fathers, that tempted God in the wilderness.11 For the which they might not enter into the land of promise.) Come, let us rejoice unto the Lord: let us sing (He showeth that God’s service standeth not in dead ceremonies, but chiefly in the sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving.) aloud unto the rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his face with praise: let us sing loud unto him with Psalms.
For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all (Even the Angels (who in respect of men are thought as gods) are nothing in his sight, much less the idols, which man’s brain inventeth.) gods,
In whose hand are the deep places of the earth, and the (All things are governed by his providence.) heights of the mountains are his,
To whom the Sea belongeth, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
Come, let us (By these three words he signifieth one thing: meaning that they must wholly give themselves to serve God.) worship and fall down, and kneel before the Lord our maker.

For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his (That is, the flock, whom he governeth with his own hand. He showeth wherein they are God’s flock, that is, if they hear his voice.) hand: today, if ye will hear his voice,

(By the contemning of God’s word.) Harden not your heart, as in (Or, in strife: whereof the place was so called.) Meribah, and as in the day of (Or, tentation, read Exod. 17:7.) Massah in the wilderness,
When your fathers (Cross references: : Exod. 17:1) tempted me, proved me, though they had seen my work.
Forty years have I contended with this generation, and said, They are a people that (They were without judgment and reason.) err in heart, for they have not known my ways.
Wherefore I sware in my wrath, saying, Surely they shall not enter into (That is, into the land of Canaan, where he promised them rest.) my rest.
